dhp321:1: They lead a well-tamed beast to the crowd;
dhp321:2: a king mounts a tamed elephant;
dhp321:3: the best of people is the tamed one
dhp322:3: and giant tuskers are all excellent;
dhp322:4: but better it is to tame oneself.
dhp323:1: For those mounts will never take you
dhp323:3: where go those who are well-tamed,
dhp324:2: is musky in rut, hard to control;
dhp324:3: bound, he eats not a bite,
dhp324:4: as he dreams of the forest.
dhp325:1: When someone’s a lazybones, a huge glutton,
dhp325:2: fond of sleep, rolling round the bed
dhp325:3: like a great hog stuffed with grain:
dhp325:4: that idiot is reborn again and again.
dhp326:1: In the past my mind wandered
dhp326:2: how it wished, where it liked, as it pleased.
dhp326:4: as a trainer with a hook guides a rutting elephant.
dhp327:2: Take good care of your mind!
dhp327:3: Pull yourself out of this pit,
dhp327:4: like a tusker from a bog.
dhp328:1: If you find an alert companion,
dhp328:4: wander with them, joyful and mindful.
dhp329:1: If you find no alert companion,
dhp329:3: then, like a king who flees his conquered realm,
dhp329:4: wander alone like a tusker in the wilds.
dhp330:3: Wander alone and do no wrong,
dhp330:4: at ease like a tusker in the wilds.”
dhp331:1: It’s nice to have a friend in need;
dhp331:2: it’s nice to be content with whatever;
dhp331:3: good deeds are nice at the end of one’s life,
dhp331:4: and giving up all suffering is nice.
dhp332:1: In this world it is nice to serve one’s mother
